ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: More about the portuguese language and theatre
Writing, critical thinking and presentation skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was excellent and well organised.
The syllabus and organisation of this class were excellent. Feedback was always given clearly and the professor always helped students clear their own doubts.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Great class and the professor is excellent
yes if interested in learning portuguese.
I would recommend this course for someone who is looking to dive in to the world of portuguese drama and for someone who looks to develop their portuguese in the real world.
Yes, I would! You can learn a lot about Brazilian history and politics through theater. The readings are engaging and diverse, so there is something for everyone.
Yes, a great way to know more about the politics and culture of Brazil.
